intro.title: 🚀 Mindset & Tech Adventure
intro.description: Develop both your mindset and technical skills through hilarious and interactive challenges
intro.subtitle: Train your brain and your code skills while laughing through the pain

phases.title: Mindset Basics
phases.intro: Test your understanding of growth vs. fixed mindset principles with realistic and funny situations.
phases.description: Dive into the foundations of a growth mindset: how to embrace challenges, reframe setbacks, and view effort as a path to mastery.
phases.scenario: Your app just crashed minutes before a demo. Panic? Blame the intern? Or... channel your inner growth warrior?

questions.question: How would you reframe: "I’m not good at this."?

options.A: I’m not good yet — but I can learn.
options.C: I'll ask someone to do it for me.
options.D: Maybe I’ll be a poet instead.

questions.explanation: Growth mindset is reflected in: 'I’m not good yet — but I can learn.'

questions.question: How would you reframe: "I failed once, I’ll always fail."?
questions.explanation: Growth mindset is reflected in: 'Failure helps me get better.'

questions.question: How would you reframe: "They’re smarter than me."?

options.D: I need a new job title.

questions.explanation: Growth mindset is reflected in: 'I can learn from them.'

questions.question: How would you reframe: "This is too hard."?

options.B: This must be someone else’s job.
options.C: My brain is allergic to effort.
options.D: I'll just fake it till I make it.

questions.explanation: Growth mindset is reflected in: 'It’s hard because I’m learning.'

questions.question: How would you reframe: "I give up."?

options.A: Let me try a different strategy.
options.C: I’ll just wait for AI to solve it.
options.D: Let me pretend this never happened.

questions.explanation: Growth mindset is reflected in: 'Let me try a different strategy.'

phases.title: Web Technologies
phases.intro: Flex your frontend and backend basics
phases.description: You’ll cover HTML, CSS, JS, frameworks, and how to avoid breaking everything with one div.
phases.scenario: You deployed the homepage. It works on your machine. On everyone else’s? A blank screen of doom.

questions.question: Your CSS is not applying. First move?
questions.explanation: Start simple. Check your selectors.

phases.title: ️‍♂️ Scraper's Detective Agency
phases.description: Learn to crawl data without being crawled by guilt or firewalls.
phases.scenario: Your scraper got blocked. Do you switch IPs, add delay, or send the website cookies?

questions.question: You get blocked after 3 requests. You:
questions.explanation: Respectful scraping includes delay and user-agent headers.

phases.title: Change is Inevitable. So is Crying.
phases.intro: Learn to survive shifting requirements and emotional damage
phases.description: Nothing is final. Clients change their minds. PMs forget what they said. You adapt.
phases.scenario: You just finished the feature. The PM says, 'Actually, we decided to pivot.'

questions.question: Best reaction to last-minute changes:

options.B: Update the Jira ticket and ask clarifying questions

questions.explanation: Be the calm in the feature-storm.

phases.title: Technical Problem Solving
phases.intro: Get serious about fixing bugs (but with memes)
phases.description: Bug fixing is like therapy: dig deep, be patient, and sometimes it’s your fault.
phases.scenario: 500 errors all over production. You have no logs. Do you panic or debug like a ninja?

questions.question: Bug only happens at midnight. You:

options.C: Ignore it and blame the timezone

questions.explanation: If you can't reproduce it, you can't fix it.

phases.title: The Daily Standup Circus
phases.intro: Learn to sound productive before coffee
phases.description: Standups are performance art. Learn how to summarize chaos in 30 seconds.
phases.scenario: You forgot what you did yesterday. Do you admit it, invent tasks, or say 'blocked by dependencies'?

questions.question: Best standup trick:
questions.explanation: It’s not lying—it’s agile improv.

phases.title: The Bug Bounty Showdown
phases.intro: Hunt bugs like a bounty hunter with caffeine issues
phases.description: Every bug you find might be worth $500—or your weekend.
phases.scenario: Your teammate finds 10 bugs before you even wake up. Will you catch up or sabotage their Wi-Fi?

questions.question: A bug gives access to user data. You:

options.C: Use it to prank your PM

questions.explanation: Ethical hacking = responsible disclosure.

phases.title: Database Diner: Order Up!
phases.intro: Order, normalize, and serve your data hot
phases.description: Design schemas like a gourmet chef: organized, delicious, and no duplicates allowed.
phases.scenario: Your client’s data is a spreadsheet with 800 columns. You must normalize it before it normalizes you.

questions.question: What’s 3rd Normal Form?

options.B: A way to eliminate transitive dependencies

questions.explanation: 3NF = reduce redundancy and dependency on non-key attributes.

phases.title: ️ Mindset Gym: No Pain, No Brain
phases.intro: Build your mental reps like a brain athlete
phases.description: Mindset isn’t magic. It’s repetition, struggle, and belief that your brain can do pushups too.
phases.scenario: You failed 3 coding interviews in a week. Do you keep going or start that bakery you always dreamed of?

questions.question: You failed your dream job interview. You:

options.D: Move to a cabin and write a blog

questions.explanation: Rejection is redirection (with better practice).
